headline: Baked Spaghetti
description: This baked spaghetti recipe is comfort food at its best. Layers of spaghetti, meat sauce, and melted mozzarella make this a perfect weeknight dinner.

video.description: A hearty baked spaghetti casserole with loads of melted cheese.
video.name: Baked Spaghetti

name: Baked Spaghetti

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender but firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain.

Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir beef and onion in the hot skillet until meat is browned and onion is soft and translucent, about 5 to 7 minutes. Drain excess oil from the pan; stir in spaghetti sauce and seasoned salt.
Whisk eggs, Parmesan, and butter in a large bowl. Add spaghetti and toss to coat.
Place 1/2 of the spaghetti mixture in the prepared baking dish. Top with 1/2 of the cottage cheese, 2 cups mozzarella, and 1/2 of the meat sauce. Repeat layers. Cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Remove the foil and sprinkle with remaining 1 cup mozzarella. Continue to bake until cheese is melted and lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: tasty and out of this world baked spaghetti also works with other pasta just fine!! Made it twice so far!! Love it!!
I added garlic and mushrooms and I used ground ilalian sausage and a little bit of breakfast sausage in place of the ground beef and it turned out really good.

I made this for my family. I did everything to the T of what the recipe said and called for. Except I used a bigger casserole dish and it fit perfectly. it was not dry and had great flavor. we will make this again thank you

This was absolutely delicious. I used a 46 oz. jar of sauce, spreading some on bottom of baking dish before adding spaghetti. I did not use season salt. Just didn't seem appealing to me. Other than that, it came out great!
Great taste!!

Made it the first time as written and loved it but the second time I played with it a bit. I added a small can of shrooms, about 3 tbl sp of sliced green olives, 1/2 lb Italian sausage, garlic & onion powder, Italian seasoning, dried parsley & chive. Not sure how much seasonings just sprinkled a bit on each cheese layer and wow did it turn out amazing..
This was great. but I switched it up bit . Left out the cottage cheese. added 1cup sharp cheddar to it.
Great recipe!

I used fettuccini. Mixed the beaten eggs into the cottage cheese along with some minced parsley and garlic powder. Tossed the fettuccini with melted butter and parmesan. Layered according to the recipe etc. It is one of the BEST casseroles I've had, my husband said "you have to make this again "!
I used turkey meat but it was still good. I used a few dishes but it was worth it. Makes a ton!

My daughter made this for a family dinner and we all loved it. We all thought it was the best baked spaghetti we'd ever had. She did use ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese & used half ground beef and half sausage and added mushrooms. We did not think it had too much spaghetti noodles. They love to spice things up so they might have used extra seasoning.

Made according to recipe. Turned out kind of bland and dry. Wish I would have used less pasta, more sauce, and added garlic and red pepper flakes. Hopefully it will be better as leftovers since there's a lot!
Very good. Very easy. Low cost per serving.
Very good - makes a lot but it will be great for leftovers! I used italian sausage but it would be good as the recipe is written with ground beef or maybe even ground turkey.

Easy to make - no fancy ingredients, including off-the-shelf spaghetti sauce. I'm not sure what the author meant by seasoned salt, but I used a product that is salt with a blend of peppers, which added some character to the sauce. Loved the result.
Superb
Very good. I was babysitting 4 yo grand babies and it got a two thumbs up from them. It must be good! Thanks for shaking up our regular old recipe.
Really good!
This was phenomenal. I agree with a lot of the other comments, make sure you have a crowd to feed. It’s just me but the rest is going to work tomorrow.
I made this tonight and agree that it needs a little more sauce. I mixed ricotta and small curd cottage cheese. Excellent and can't wait to make it again!
This came out so good, I’m going to try to half it next time though.

My main compliant was I couldn't find a 30oz jar of sauce. Other than that, I followed the recipe to a T. It's A LOT of food! Very tasty! I'll definitely make it again but, I think I'd leave the chopped onion out & use onion powder.
This is an amazing dish. The only thing I change is I always use much more spaghetti sauce (48 oz) and I replace hamburger with Italian sausage.

I use ricotta cheese instead of cottage. I also use shredded cheddar jack for the shredded cheese. Love this recipe! It is our absolute favorite! Leftovers are even better the next day. Freezes very nicely.
I liked this recipe. I used ricotta instead of cottage cheese and omitted onions, but other than that, followed the recipe. Make sure you have a lot of mouths to feed-this makes a LOT!
I love this recipe and the family love the spaghetti

Although everyone in this house is quite satisfied with this recipe as written I've varied the ingredients from time to time. For example, using Ricotta instead of cottage cheese or a mixture of both. Or, adding Italian sausage to the beef/onion mixture. The most positive responses coming from "my crew" have come when I dress this up more to resemble my bake lasagna by adding pepperoni. During the final step, I also sprinkle with finely chopped green onion.

Quick to get together with things I regularly have stashed for such moments. As an observation re others' critique of cottage cheese: Having that in my frig is much more versatile, and I don't like ricotta . Jarred sauce is waiting in the cupboard....I don't always have time for 'home made, and find certain types quite satisfactory. Add some extra seasoning (garlic, herbs) and we are off to the races. I too cook nightly. In a small rural town, with plenty of activities following my workday. This and a salad, and some garlic toast...bam!
Have made on several occasions for large crowds (50, 100, 150 ppl). Everyone always wants the recipe. So easy to make !
Use ricotta, not cottage cheese.
I made it exactly as is. I did not like it as it is basically Lasagna substituting Spaghetti. I found it bland and forgettable. Again, this is my opinion. Yes, I do cook, nightly.
My husband's favorite food is baked spaghetti. He's the cook in the family but I wanted to make this for him. Glad I did! He said it was the best he's had. It's hearty and so flavorful. Easy to make.
Added 1 lbs sweet ground Italian sausage and mixed in a 1/2 cup of cheddar cheese.
This recipe was fantastic my kids love this it has become their favorite.

This has become a regular at our house. 5 of us and one who doesn't eat meat. I make it without ground beef/meat and everyone still eats it up. Only change I've learned to make regularly is to use an extra half or more jar of sauce. I've replaced cottage cheese w/ ricotta when it's what I have on hand but prefer the cottage cheese for the moisture content.
Fantastic!
This was an amazing dish I use cream cheese instead of cottage cheese, delicious
I loved it, but it needs more sauce. I'll use more sauce on the bottom, before I add the spaghetti, next time.
Loved the result and so did the whole family. Am I the only one who couldn't fit this into a 9 x 13" pan?
Made it as instructed but would like to add shredded zucchini next time. Thank you for a tasty recipe. This is a definitely a keeper.

I know, I know, I tweaked it. But I really liked the outcome! I didn't have cottage cheese or mozzarella so I used sour cream and cheddar cheese. I also didn't add meat because I don't eat meat aside from fish and I replaced onions for onion powder. Besides, the tomato sauce I used had onions in it. BUT, again, I really enjoyed the outcome and I think it would've been just as good, perhaps even more if I used chopped onions, cottage cheese, and mozzarella! Definitely try this!

Took a chance making it for the first time AND giving it away. Made the recipe as written but used two 8x8 dishes instead of long pan. Worked out perfect. Will definitely make this again for company. Tastes amazing and so easy!
Too much cheese and noodles. Not enough sauce. I will make this again and use half the cheese.
Followed the recipe. Absolutely delicious. I have shared this recipe with all my friends
I made this recipe and my family loved it. I was nervous but it turned out really good.

Follow the recipe and make it right! I have always used Kraft mozzarella cheese and fresh grated parmesan and a top notch marinara sauce with lean ground beef and this recipe has been a star in my home for 8 years now! My suggestion is don’t mess it up and ground turkey sucks! Be careful seasoning the meat because the cheese is already salty and will make it nasty flavored.
iIt was great!
I made this today for me and my family and we all love it! My Mom wouldn’t stop talking about how delicious it was!
Big family favorite! Even for non spaghetti lovers. Super easy recipe and takes little effort to prepare.

I loved this recipe for the idea of baked spaghetti, but I could tell for my family's taste, it would be a bit dry. I make this for my son, daughter in law and 3 teenagers and they ALWAYS love it! I change it up a bit: I use angel hair pasta, 2 jars of spaghetti sauce because I use 1 lb. Of hamburger and 1/2 lb. Spicy Italian sausage and I add one green bell pepper and mushrooms and simmer for an hour. I also use a large carton of cottage cheese and twice as much of cheese...whatever I have. I use a large foil pan and it all fits perfectly. This is a super good recipe, that can be altered according to family taste. I do like to sometimes make it more Mexican style using pepper jack cheeses and cumin and chili powder, or, Italian style with oregano. Pluse, I always cook with onion powder and fresh garlic. Definitely a keeper!!!!
This meal was perfect!! I wouldn’t change a thing. I even shared the recipe with my daughter. Thank you!!

We love this recipe!!! I have made this several times , but this one time I added 1 bell pepper and teaspoon of garlic powder. I put in the extra work and it really didn’t need it my family loves it both ways.
It was really good. I used Ricotta instead of cottage cheese.

Very good as is but I tweaked it. 1) Used Fideo (1" spaghetti) 2) Added bell pepper to the onions 3) Added 6 oz bottle of red wine, crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce to the marinara and simmered sauce to reduce it 4) Added mozzarella and parmesano to the cottage cheese mixture. 5) Did not cover and baked for 10 minutes longer instead of uncovering it and baking 20 longer.
This is very good! I make my own sauce, I don't use jarred sauce. That's the only changes I made.

Very yummy and was a hit for leftovers too. I did add seasonings (I think it would have been bland without it) - garlic, oregano and basil. I also plan to double the meat next time as it seemed light on meat compared to noodles. Overall very good though!
I made this last night for my family and it was awesome. I also made garlic knots to go with it.....all was super yummy. Will be making this again.
I tweaked it a little but it was really good and a bit with the family!! Just used elbow macaroni and cheddar cheese instead of what was called for.
THIS IS A SUPER RECIPE
My family loves this recipe! The cottage cheese is not as sharp as the ricotta cheese and it makes this recipe a winner in my opinion! Will will make this recipe again and again!
Really good - very filling. Added more sauce per suggestions. Otherwise followed recipe as written.
I made this exactly as written and it was absolutely delicious! I will make this again! Good for a crowd too!
It was def quick and easy- but lacked flavor and needed more sauce. Will try again and add more savory and less pasta and more noodles .
Delicious recipe! Usually I tweak recipes as I go along but I followed this one carefully and it came out super good! Even my super picky husband loves it!
For a guy who doesn't cook much, this recipe was super easy to make and impressed the family! I call it poor man's lasagna.
One of my dad's favorite meals!

My kids loved it. I used half the spaghetti but all other measurements were the same. I used ricotta instead of cottage cheese. I also used my own meatballs that were frozen. The eggs, butter, and parm are what really make this a great recipe I think. First time making baked spaghetti.
Excellent! Need a little extra sauce to put on the top when served. Very filling!
Very Very good! 6 stars!
Easy comfort food
Added extra sauce from comments. It was a hit! I cut recipe to four servings to test at home and will definitely make for next large gathering.
It was really good!

I have made this countless times over the last few years. The family always asks for it and looks forward to eating it every time I make it. It is so delicious. We prefer more meat sauce in it than is called for. This recipe is my go-to for big gatherings. It’s the best one I’ve found for baked spaghetti!
Easy, filling, and a hit with everyone!
This was delicious!!
Used Ricotta instead of cottage cheese! Amazing!

This is a fine recipe. I make it about 20% bigger than the recipe, plus a bit more cheese. The resulting bake in a 9" x 13" pan provides NINE healthy servings. 

Our 40 year-old son still lives at home with us. Even HE is satisfied with the size of the portions; we get three full meals out of this.
I didn't buy enough mozzarella so I used the rest of the grated Parmesan and it came out tastey!

My family could not get enough. They ate it that evening for dinner and hen the next day for breakfast and lunch. Best recipe I’ve made that did not need any changes. I’m making it again this week for out of town guest. It’s Delicious!

I made this for a family dinner, and everyone raved about it. I honestly think it will become the go-to for spaghetti, instead of spaghetti out of a pot. 

I followed the recipe to the letter, except the order of layering the ingredients into the baking dish. I put the mozzarella on top of the meat sauce, because I like the melted cheese on top.

This was simple to make. I doubled up on the sauce (I used meat sauce, that’s what I had on hand) and used only mozzarella cheese (that’s all I had at home). My family loved this and I will NOT go back to making boring spaghetti again. Thank you for a great recipe.
Family loved it!! Thank you!
I made it as written with the exception of using whole wheat pasta. We liked it. it's basically lasagna with spaghetti noodles but a great meal.
Delicious! Took this to my church small group and they ate it up!!!
We loved it! Instead of mozzarella cheese I added 2 other types... Coby Jack and Mexican and it still turned out to be delicious. Definitely a recipe I will keep repeating. Thank you
Great Sunday dinner. Takes alittle time to prepare but everyone who eats it will appreciate the time you took. Add Garlic bread and side salad .Yummy!!!

Great baked pasta....i read the ingredients incorrectly....used 4 cups of cottage cheese and 2 cups mozzarella..still turned out great. I too would also add a second jar of sauce and a wee bit more parmesan to the egg mixture. Wonderful
Truly enjoyed making this Rendition of Traditional spaghetti. My family was happy with a new way . I made with a side of honey cornbread yummy

Any, and I mean ANY spaghetti recipe that uses only ground beef as the sole meat is bound to be hopelessly bland. Like "elementary school lunchroom spaghetti" bland. Substitute Italian sausage, either half sausage or all sausage and this dish will be exponentially better. ??

Loved this!! My husband and I liked it better than regular lasagna. It’s just the two of us, so we are the leftovers for a week and didn’t get tired of it! This will be one of my go-to dinners from now on!
Very nice....exchanged ricotta for cottage cheese.

I made this exactly as shown and it was very good. The only slight problem is that the noodles seemed to be a bit much and there wasn’t enough meat sauce. My only suggestion would be to cut the noodles down to 8 oz.
This was simple and delicious! Substituted ricotta cheese for cottage cheese. Try it...you will love it!
The best recipe!! Lots of work, but totally worth it!
Excellent recipe as written. A family favorite.
I made this for dinner tonight. FANTASTIC! The only thing I did differently was to add the cottage cheese to the meat mixture. And the eggs are IMPORTANT! They help hold it all together.

I don’t know if it’s because I was cooking with the power off due to a storm or what, but it was the most messy meal I’ve ever made. I got sauce, cheese, and vegetables everywhere. It also took me an hour of prep not 25 minutes. I’d also like to add that a 9x13 was not big enough, I had to separate the layers into two dishes. I didn’t realize this until after I had already started with the second layer, so it made a mess and the second dish turned out mixed instead of layered. I also noticed a flaw in the recipe it says do pasta, cottage cheese, mozzarella, and then meat sauce. However it should be pasta, cottage cheese, meat sauce, then mozzarella, because otherwise it’s meat sauce on top. Thank god I had enough cheese to put another layer otherwise the fish would of looked odd without it. All of that aside it was delicious, and I have plenty of left overs! I’d recommend this recipe to others, but not without warning them of the mess and stress that comes with this recipe.
I made this according to directions and it was fabulous! The hubby had 3 portions and has taken leftovers twice this week. This will go into a regular rotation moving forward.

I made as directed BUT:
 The parmesean clumped on my utensil when i was trying to toss the egg mixture into the spaghetti. So no cheese. I will sprinkle the parmesean on the first layer rather than in the egg mixture. Parmesean cheese does NOT melt easily.
 Secondly, not enough sauce
 Thirdly I chopped fresh spinach and was great!
